intro: Mesembryanthemum serrulatum, commonly known as the serrated ice plant, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and vibrant, daisy-like flowers. The plant is typically found in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are often covered in fine, white hairs, which help reduce water loss and reflect sunlight. Mesembryanthemum serrulatum is a popular ornamental plant due to its hardiness and ability to bloom throughout the year.
